intro: Anaphalioides subrigida, commonly known as the rigid sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with narrow, linear leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical structure reflects its ecological niche as a hardy, xerophytic species.
